New Records: Shohei Ohtani hit his National League-leading 44th home run
Key Match Events: Tommy Edman broke a 6-6 tie with a two-run single in the top of the ninth inning
Ohtani hit a game-tying sacrifice fly in the second inning after Arizona turned a 3-0 deficit into a 4-3 lead in the bottom of the first
Pre-Game Insights: Ohtani, Mookie Betts, and Freddie Freeman hit consecutive homers for the Dodgers to lead off the game against Merrill Kelly
It is the fifth time this season that the Japanese slugger has homered leading off the first inning
Post-Match Reflections: The Dodgers extended their NL West lead to six games by taking the first two of a four-game set against the second-place D-backs

Shohei Ohtani of the Los Angeles Dodgers hits his National League-leading 44th home run leading off the first inning against the Arizona Diamondbacks on Aug. 31, 2024, at Chase Field in Phoenix, Arizona
Miscellaneous Highlights: Among other Japanese players in the majors, Houston Astros left-hander Yusei Kikuchi (7-9) picked up the win after striking out 12 in seven innings of one-run ball in a 5-2 victory over the Kansas City Royals
Ohtani finished the night 1-for-5 while his 98 RBIs tied him with Marcell Ozuna of the Atlanta Braves for the NL lead
